Sudan: Inside besieged El-Obeid, the war's new frontline
description: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (1/6). For nearly three years, Sudan has been torn apart by a conflict between the national army and the militias of the Rapid Support Forces, leaving some 200,000 people dead. For the first time, Le Monde traveled to El-Obeid, a city threatened by paramilitary forces and now crucial for controlling the country's center.

Eurostar resumes service across Europe after power problem
description: A power glitch in the Channel Tunnel caused major disruptions to train services between London, Paris and Amsterdam, prompting the train company to urge passengers to delay travel. Getlink, the tunnel's operator, later said traffic was expected to return to normal overnight.

headline: Israeli drones make life miserable for residents of southern Lebanon
description: The constant presence of surveillance and attack drones flying over the border region is putting pressure on the Lebanese population and fueling fears of a return to full-scale war.

headline: Berlin's dangerous fascination with homemade firecrackers and fireworks
description: Police unions and doctors' associations are calling for a ban on the private use of pyrotechnic devices, which cause injuries every New Year's Eve. But the German capital defends its libertarian spirit and its festive reputation.

headline: Dining at the Centre Pompidou-Metz
description: 'A Meal at the Museum' (4/6). Charles Coulombeau, the chef of the brasserie Umé, reinvents French classics with a Japanese twist. His cuisine is as inventive as the museum's art.

Israel: The MAGA world's new obsession
description: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to meet with US President Donald Trump in Miami on Monday, December 29, Israel has become a source of contention and fantasy within the Trump movement.

headline: Dog photographer, a new niche profession: 'The key is to avoid the tongue hanging out'
description: Even though the photo galleries of their 'parents' are typically replete with dog photos, a new generation of professional photographers is nonetheless making a living out of artfully crafted canine portraits.

headline: Europe's dramatic decline in pharmaceutical production threatens health sovereignty
description: The rise of China and India, combined with protectionist pressure from the Trump administration, is redrawing the global map of the pharmaceutical industry. The Europe-wide deindustrialization that began in the 2000s is now accelerating.
